New Records: Angola secured their biggest ever Cup of Nations finals win with a 3-0 victory over Namibia.
Gelson Dala scored twice, including a goal from a free-kick, and became a key player in the match.
Key Match Events: Neblu received a red card in the 17th minute, putting Angola at a disadvantage early on.
Gelson Dala scored the first goal for Angola in the 38th minute, and then converted a free-kick to double his tally in the 42nd minute.
Mabululu scored Angola's third goal in the second half, solidifying the victory.
Post-Match Reflections: Angola's players and staff celebrated wildly after the win, showing the significance of the match for them.
Angola's next opponent will be the winners of the Nigeria vs. Cameroon match in the quarterfinals.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played at Stade de Bouaké in Bouaké, Ivory Coast, with an attendance of 28,663 fans.
The final scoreline was 3-0 in favor of Angola.
Others: This was Angola's first win in the Cup of Nations, marking a strong performance in the tournament.
